title: Shadow Blade (Spell)
content:

Level 2 Illusion Spell

Weave a shadowy shortsword in your hand that deals 2~16 Psychic damage.

When you use the sword to attack a target that is in dim light or darkness, you make the Attack Roll with Advantage.

The shadow blade can be unequipped and equipped again, but must remain on the spellcaster's person.

Concentration Short Rest

Shadow Blade is a Spell in Baldur's Gate 3. Shadow Blade is a Level 2 Spell from the Illusion Spells. Spells can be used for dealing damage to Enemies, inflicting Status Ailments, buff Characters, or interacting with the environment.

Shadow Blade Information

Description: Weave a shadowy shortsword in your hand that deals 2~16 Psychic damage. When you use the sword to attack a target that is in dim light or darkness, you make the Attack Roll with Advantage. The shadow blade can be unequipped and equipped again, but must remain on the spellcaster's person. Level: Level 2 Spell School: Illusion Casting Time: Bonus Action + Level 2 Spell Slot Range: n/a Requires Concentration: Yes Saving Throw: n/a

How to Acquire Shadow Blade

Shadow Blade can be acquired by the following classes:

Class level 3: Sorcerer, Warlock, and Wizard Class level 7: Arcane Trickster Class level 8: Eldritch Knight

Shadow Blade can be cast by using the following Items:

Shadow Blade Ring

Shadow Blade Tips & Notes

The created shortsword has the properties Finesse, Light and Dippable (except fire). The proficiency for the Shadow Blade is either Simple Weapons or Shortswords, though Shortswords are normally Martial Weapons. It cannot be dipped in fire. The weapon created cannot be disarmed. The passive Advantage when attacking a target in dim light or darkness is bugged and does not work.
